subject: Business
title: Knowing When to Step Down
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Knowing When to Step Down.

hook.text: George Washington could have been president for life. He served two terms and walked away. That exit defined America.

buildup.text: Knowing when to leave is the most underrated leadership skill. Overstaying erodes legacy.

discovery.text: Leaders who stay too long become defensive, resistant to change, and surrounded by yes-people.

twist.text: The best time to leave is when things are going well. Exiting on a high lets the successor build, not rebuild.

climax.text: Jack Ma stepped down from Alibaba at 55, healthy and at the peak. The company thrived without him.

punchline.text: A great leader's final act is making themselves unnecessary.

quiz.question: When is the best time for a leader to step down?
options: When things are going well, so the successor can build on momentum
Only after a major failure forces the decision
